threadPerformance.best: 4:30 PM Update Brief (35 views) — posted in the sweet spot window, Anthropic $30B news was fresh
threadPerformance.recap7PM: 17 views — Friday evening, lower engagement typical
threadPerformance.update6PM: 12 views — lower than expected, possibly cannibalized by 4:30 PM thread
threadPerformance.hotTakes: 4-14 views — Anthropic $30B hot take got 14 views + 1 like, best performing standalone

replyPerformance.bestTone: Product-focused explainer (what it means for devs/creators)
replyPerformance.optimalTargetViews: 100K-400K parent thread views (less competition, better visibility)
replyPerformance.worstPerforming: Reply-to-replies on own threads (5 views avg — low distribution)
replyPerformance.keyInsight: Zero likes on most replies despite decent views — too analytical, not enough emotion/opinion

competitorInsights.note: Based on engagement log targets and feed observation
observations: High-engagement accounts (@Star_Knight12, @antigravity) lead with bold opinions THEN explain — we do the reverse
Viral AI accounts use 1-2 sentence hooks that create curiosity gaps — our threads open with formatted headers
mfer community accounts (@SOL_mfer, @hoodiemfer) get organic engagement through personality, not analysis
Top accounts reply within 15-30 min of big news breaking — speed matters more than depth for replies
Accounts with strong growth use quote-tweets of big accounts rather than just replies

recommendations: 1. LEAD WITH BOLD TAKES: Flip reply structure — start with a punchy opinion (1 sentence), THEN add analysis. 'This changes everything for X' beats 'This is actually huge for onboarding new devs...'

2. TARGET MID-RANGE THREADS: Focus replies on 100K-400K view tweets. Skip 600K+ mega-threads where we get buried. The Seedance reply (75 views on 259K parent) outperformed the OpenAI reply (53 views on 1.2M parent).
3. SHIFT RECAP TO 5 PM: The 4:30 PM thread (35 views) crushed the 7:15 PM recap (17 views). Friday evening is dead. Move daily recap to 5-5:30 PM window on weekends.
